title: Here One Moment
description: From the author of bestselling phenomenon Big Little Lies comes a compelling novel of family and fate, as a mysterious old woman sows confusion and paranoia in the lives of a disparate group of individuals.
synopsis: On a plane bound for Sydney the unassuming woman from seat 4D walks down the aisle making unsettling predictions about the passengers. And six strangers find their lives unexpectedly crossing. Each tries to put the experience behind them. But, just weeks later, they can't any longer. Because not believing a prediction is easy, Until it comes true . . .

title: In Too Deep: (Jack Reacher 29)
description: Reacher finds himself the captive of a gang who have some very disturbing plans in this rollercoaster ride of a thriller...
synopsis: Reacher had no idea where he was. No idea how he had got there. But someone must have brought him...

title: Sunrise on the Reaping
description: The eagerly awaited fifth Hunger Games book - and second prequel - places fan-favourite Haymitch Abernathy centre stage in an unputdownable tale of danger, action and intrigue set during the fiftieth deadly contest
synopsis: When you've been set up to lose everything you love, what is there left to fight for?...

title: Nobody's Fool
description: From the mega-selling author of Tell No One and Think Twice comes the electrifying sequel to Fool Me Once...
synopsis: A year after the devastating events that took place in Fool Me Once, a secret from former Detective Sami Kierce's college days comes back to haunt him...

title: 25 Alive
description: The Women's Murder Club return in the 25th riveting instalment in Patterson's bestselling series...
synopsis: Sergeant Lindsay Boxer's friend and former partner is brutally murdered in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park...

title: Madly, Deeply: The Alan Rickman Diaries
description: The beloved and much-missed actor offers his legion of fans a window into Hollywood glamour...
synopsis: Alan Rickman remains one of the most beloved actors of all time across almost every genre...

title: 38 Londres Street
description: Through this captivating blend of memoir, travelogue, detective story, and courtroom drama, the award-winning author of East West Street and The Last Colony chronicles the entwining stories of Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet and senior SS officer Walther Rauff in a powerful examination of historical atrocities and the search for justice.
synopsis: In the heart of Santiago, the infamous 38 Londres Street becomes the haunting backdrop for a riveting tale that intertwines the arrest of Augusto Pinochet in London, the post-war life of senior SS officer Walther Rauff in Chilean Patagonia and the sinister connections between the two men. Rauff, responsible for the wartime horrors of mobile gas vans, flees justice after the war and finds an unlikely refuge in Chile...

title: The Let Them
description: The bestselling motivational coach behind The High 5 Habit delivers an empowering philosophy for breaking free of other people's negative energy and living your best life.
synopsis: The Let Them Theory puts the power to create a life you love back in your hands, and this book will show you exactly how to do it.

title: Shakespeare
description: Recounted with Dame Judi Dench's characteristic twinkling wit, this endlessly fascinating volume finds the legendary actress reflecting on every Shakespearean performance in her stellar career.
synopsis: Taking a curtain call with a live snake in her wig... Acting opposite a child with a pumpkin on his head... Judi Dench shares her experiences and reflections on every Shakespearean role she has played throughout her seven-decade career.

title: The Last Secret Agent
description: In this vivid and eye-opening tale of wartime service and danger, the last surviving SOE agent recounts her time working behind enemy lines in Nazi-occupied France for the first time.
synopsis: 'You know you can change your mind, don't you? Even now. Even when you are halfway across the English Channel. Any time before you jump.' Yes, she did. An hour later, she was parachuting into Nazi-occupied France to begin a mission that was fraught with danger...

title: Fearless
description: Paedyn and Kai embark upon their final adventure in the thrilling conclusion to Roberts' megaselling YA romantasy series.
synopsis: Paedyn Gray and Kai Azer return to the Kingdom of Ilya... And Paedyn has a life-altering choice to make. Whatever she decides will determine her fate – and the fate of those around her – forever. In the ultimate battle of love and loyalty, who wins? Be swept away by the conclusion to the smash hit, dagger-to-the-throat romantasy trilogy.

title: Ali Mau
description: The much anticipated memoir by media personality Alison Mau. In my family, we never talked about the past... Since the age of twelve, Alison Mau wanted to be a journalist just like her dad. A beer-swilling, straight-talking man who was rough around the edges but could quote passages of Hamlet at will, he taught Ali everything from rabbit-hunting to throwing a punch and crafting a sharp sentence.
synopsis: The much anticipated memoir by media personality Alison Mau recounts her life, from her beginnings in Melbourne to her rise as New Zealand's media darling. A story of overcoming challenges, sexual abuse, and a deep dive into the #MeToo movement.

title: Frankie
description: This expansive, heartfelt story of memory and human connection from the bestselling author of Home Stretch and A Keeper finds an elderly Londoner and her young Irish carer bond, as the titular protagonist tells him the story of her past filled with larger-than-life characters.
synopsis: Frankie Howe has lived a long life, and her small London flat is crammed full of art, furniture, and memories. Damian, her young carer, listens as she gradually tells him parts of her story, from New York's art scene to her life in London. Frankie discovers that life is not always the one we hope for, or the one others expect of us.
